title: Looking for any of these 98 cards with Howe McCormick’s stamp on the back
author: Howe’s Hunter

posts.post_title: Looking for any of these 98 cards with Howe McCormick’s stamp on the back
posts.post_content:
Wow, thanks to everyone here, the number wasn’t an even 100 very long. Adkins and Leifield pitching are now off the list. I’ve removed those images from the posts also. Thanks again to everyone for keeping g an eye out for these.

If there is a * next to the name, I know it exists. At the end of the list are images of a couple of the cards listed if you want to know what the stamp looks like. As always, thanks to so many Net54 members who have gotten me to this point of rebuilding a complete set, if Howe had one.

posts.post_title: Couple more images of those I've missed
posts.post_content:
Missed out on Reagan almost 14 years ago, and haven't seen him resurface yet.

Missed out on Street in Jan/Feb of this year when I thought my bid was high enough to snag him off eBay, but someone wanted him more.
Heck I got that exact Leifield

posts.post_title: Beer Can, it has Howe’s stamp on the back?
posts.post_content: If so, mark it sold and send me contact info please.

I just sent you the message ,
The others are Howe cards also if anyone’s interested ,
Send me a message - I do want to avoid polluting Ed’s thread

posts.post_title: Thanks, Eric. Message received and responded to
posts.post_content:
Thanks to everyone on the board for letting me know when they see one or find one in their collection. 

Must admit, I was bummed when the Goldin lot came to auction and my hopes of having all of Howe’s cards reunited crumbled. But instead, trying to make a complete set has turned out to be an even better adventure. Thanks, Paul M. for the idea. 

Since Scott broke up the huge lot, this card (and one other on its way from earlier in the week) brings the number of cards in that 975 card lot that I didn’t have an example of down to just 10 now. I know who owns four of them, and after an initial exchange of emails two years ago, he has chosen not to respond to any communications. I’ll just hope there is at least one other example of those four cards that I can find. 

Again, thanks to everyone. I’ll keep posting new ones in the monthly pick-up threads and updating the list here as they are found.

Ed sent you the tracking number
Thanks Eric
Was always pretty sure if he had a Wagner, he must have had a Magie error. Never in my price range, but confirmation that it existed. Sold last September by Goldin.
